name: Way of the Solid Fist
desc: Your fists are like living stone, protecting you from ills even as they batter a foe.

name: Way of the Rising Leg
desc: You have adopted a martial arts style focused on kicks, granting you frightful agility.

name: Way of the Unbreakable Grip
desc: Once you grasp a foe they can make no escape, trapped as they are within your arms.

name: Scent of Blood
desc: Your blade veers towards a creature's wound, exploiting it instantly.
effect: The target may Negate with 2 _Reflex_. If they do not, treat their topmost _Bleed_ as an _Vulnerable_ of twice its value (maximum 6).

name: Ice Pole
special: After you _Hit_/_Crit_ with a Melee or Ranged Attack with this Weapon, you may _Destroy_ it. If it was Melee, inflict 2 _Frost_ (2 _Grit_) on the Target. If it was ranged, inflict 1 _Frost_ (1 _Grit_) on the Target and create an _Icicle_ in a space adjacent to them.

name: Flame Bladed
special:
Anytime a Strike with this Weapon would inflict _Bleed_, instead inflict _Burn_.
This Weapon cannot be Destroyed by Attacks.

name: Stone Gauntlet
special: When you take a Block Reaction you may Destroy the Stone Gauntlet to increase your _Armor_ by 1 against the triggering Attack.

name: Water Whip
special:
You may Destroy the Water Whip on a _Hit_/_Crit_ to increase the Damage and _Pull_ by 2 and, if you wish, replace all _Pull_ with _Push_.
This Weapon cannot be Destroyed by Attacks.

name: Wind Bladed
special:
All attacks with the Wind Bladed are at Advantage. If a creature uses a _Block_ Reaction, reduce the Attack Roll by an additional 1. If this makes the Attack _Miss_,  pay 1 _Momentum_/_Destroy_ the _Wind Bladed_.
This Weapon cannot be Destroyed by Attacks.

name: Axebreaker Style
desc: You make use of the nimbleness of a blade to thwart slower weapons with ease.
respite: Gain 2 _Momentum_ at Refresh if you are Wielding a _Bladed_ Weapon.
effect: Reduce the Attack Roll of all Attacks with _Hafted_ Weapons that target you by 1 as long as you are Wielding a _Bladed_ Weapon.
special: You may use the Counter Reaction for no Cost when attacked with a _Hafted_ Weapon as long as you are Wielding a _Bladed_ Weapon.

name: Press the Attack!
desc: You recklessly push an attack into an advantage.
effect: _Wager_ Momentum with the Target of the Attack. If you win, you may reroll the Attack and gain 1 _Momentum_. Otherwise, reduce the Attack Roll by 1.

name: Swordbreaker Style
desc: You make use of the range of your lance to easily keep blades away.
respite: Gain 2 _Momentum_ at Refresh if you are Wielding a _Pole_ Weapon.
effect: Reduce the Attack Roll of all Attacks with _Bladed_ Weapons that target you by 1 as long as you are Wielding a _Pole_ Weapon.
special: You may use the Counter Reaction for no Cost when attacked with a _Bladed_ Weapon as long as you are Wielding a _Pole_ Weapon.

name: Earth Tomb
desc: By using nearby earth and stone the Earthbonded seals their foe away.
target: A Size 1 creature adjacent to at least two _Earthen Feature_s.
effect: Attack the target with the below Profile, destroying the _Earthen_ Obstacles. On a _Hit_/_Crit_,  _Entomb_ the creature in an _Earth Pillar_. A creature may end this _Entomb_ by _Sacrificing_ an Action and spending 4 _Grit_ or by destroying the _Earth Pillar_. If a creature spends _Reflex_ to Negate, they must immediately Move 1 and fall _Prone_. An _Earth Pillar_ is then created in their original space. If they cannot Move, they may not spend _Reflex_ in this way.
special: If there are 4 adjacent _Earthen_ Obstacles: Either this Attack is _Accurate_, or you may target a Size 2 creature and _Entomb_ them in an _Earth Column_. Destroy all _Earthen_ Obstacles used for this Attack.
boost: 2 _Grit_, 1 _Momentum_: Add _Groundsource_. You may resolve the normal Effect without any _Earthen_ Obstacles.

name: Collapse
desc: A powerful technique that creates a cave below the ground, then collapses the ground downwards, sending enemies into a painful fall.
effect: All spaces in the area become _Rough_ and a _Hazard_. At the end of the Round, resolve the below Attack in the same Area and decrease the Area's Elevation by 3.
imbue: 1 _Grit_: Increase the Speed of this Technique by 1. You may use this Imbue multiple times but must increase its Cost by 1 each time.

name: Burrow
desc: The Earthbonded moves through the earth like a mole, safely reaching their destination.
effect: This Movement ignores all Terrain, Elevation, and Obstacles.

name: Dual Wielder
desc: You fight best with a weapon in either hand, allowing you to create a barrage of unavoidable strikes.

name: Duelist
desc: You always keep one hand free in combat, providing you a flexibility and fluidity that few can match.

name: Grappler
desc: So long as you have a hand free you'll have an opponent in it, dragging them about the battlefield. The Grappler Discipline specializes in controlling one or two targets at a time to an exceptional degree. While a creature's offense is somewhat limited while grappling, it allows for unparalleled freedom in repositioning a foe. It is trivial for a Grappler to impose Disadvantage on the attacks of their grappled foes and a variety of Techniques that limit the arms a creature can use and knock them Prone are extremely common throughout this Discipline. While it will require a large amount of Grit to maintain the Grapple, it provides some of the hardest control in the game.

name: Heavy Weapon Master
desc: A lesser warrior is controlled by the heavy weight of a large weapon; you have mastered it and honed it into a deadly pendulum.

name: Berserker
desc: You find yourself in the front lines, striking with fury and little regard to your own defense.

name: Brawler
desc: Your fighting style is wild and unpredictable, using the environment itself as often as your weapons.

name: Gladiator
desc: You practice a flashy, energetic combat style that energizes your allies and demoralizes your foes.

name: Scoundrel
desc: You fight dirty, relying on clever tricks and cheap shots to carry you to victory.

name: Warlord
desc: You lead your companions from the front, create opportunities for them to strike and rallying them to your side.

name: Weapon Master
desc: You change weapons faster than most can blink, always keeping the one at hand to provide the greatest benefit.

name: Aggressive Advance
desc: You dart forward at great speed, punishing any that interfere.
effect: Take the Movements in any order. You may take any number of _Punish_ Reactions this _Turn_. Reduce the Cost of _Punish_ Reactions by 1 this _Turn_.
special: You may choose to take only one of the listed Movements. If you do, gain 1 _Momentum_.
boost: 1 _Momentum_: Make a _Glancing_ 2 AP Basic Strike at the end of either step of this Movement.
imbue:
Choose one:
* Speed is instead 2, and Move is Step, Reposition.
* Speed is instead 3, and Move is Reposition, Reposition.

name: Pursuit
desc: You chase a foe as they attempt to flee, dedicated to keeping them within your reach.
cost: 1 _Reflex_, 1 _Momentum_, +1 _Momentum_ if the Attack is Speed 3 or slower.
trigger: An enemy within your Reach moves outside your Reach.
effect: At the end of that creature's turn, immediately Attack the triggering enemy with a _Maneuver_/_Weapon Strike_. You must use any _Movement_ granted by the chosen _Technique_ to move towards the enemy, ending this Reaction as close to them as possible. If you are adjacent to the target, make the Attack with _Advantage_.
boost: 1 _Momentum_. You may instead Attack with any _Strike_.

name: Sudden Charge
desc: A reckless charge that always brings you closer to a nearby foe.
move:
The movement granted by Charge determines its Speed, as follows: 
* <ins>Step:</ins> Speed 1 
*  <ins>Reposition:</ins> Speed 2 
* <ins>Dash:</ins> Speed 4
effect: If you end your Movement next to a creature you may inflict _Vulnerable_ 1 (1 _Poise_) on them.
special: All Movement granted by this Technique must be used to move directly towards an enemy by the shortest possible route.
boost: 1 _Momentum_/_Reflex_: Increase the Movement by one tier, but all _Punish_ Attacks against you this _Turn_ have _Advantage_.

name: Anchor
effect: An Anchor is a sufficiently large Metal Source that is either secured or heavy enough that a Metalbound can pull themselves towards it without moving it. Typically, any Metal Source of a Size greater than the Metalbound can be used as an Anchor, but a wall-sconce that is heavily bolted into the wall may also serve as an Anchor at the GM's discretion.

name: Metal Source
effect: A Metal Source is any amount of metal sufficient for use by a Metalbound. Any Weapon that is crafted predominately of metal counts as a Metal Source as well as any similarly-sized metal objects in the environment, but using them in conjunction with Metalbound features will typically Damage them. A Metalbound can reduce their _Armor_'s _Guard_ value by 1 to create a Metal Source when wearing _Armor_ made predominately of metal. If this reduces the _Armor_'s _Guard+ value to 0, the Metalbound is treated as Unarmored. Finally, a Metalbound is always assumed to be wearing sufficient metal for a single Source, so long as they have their gear on hand. After being used for an ability, track the location of all Metal Sources on the map.

name: Water Source
effect: A Water Source is any space that is predominantly filled with water. What happens to a Water Source when it is Destroyed depends on the type. If it's part of an extremely large source, such as an ocean or lake it instead remains as existing water rushes in to fill the void. If it's part of a smaller source, such as a pond or spring, Destroy the target space, or, if the target space is central to the body, Destroy a space near the edge of the source of water, trying to maintain as even a shape as possible.

name: Wood Source
effect: A Wood Source is any amount of wood sufficient for use by a Woodbound. Any Weapon that is crafted predominately of wood counts as a Wood Source as well as any similarly-sized wood objects in the environment, but using them in conjunction with Woodbound features will typically Damage them. A Woodbound can Damage a shield made of Wood to create a Wood Source. After being used for an ability, track the location of all Wood Sources on the map. In addition, large sources of wood, such as a tree, can sometimes can as multiple Wood Sources. If they do, they will designated as such by your GM. Finally, a Woodbound is always assumed to be wearing sufficient wood for a single Source, so long as they have their gear on hand. After being used for an ability, track the location of all Wood Sources on the map.

name: Icy
effect:
Icy Terrain is coated in thick ice, making it incredibly slippery. A character may only move in a straight line on Icy Terrain. If a character ends their Turn on Icy Terrain they must spend 1 Skill or fall Prone. In addition, if a creature is Pushed or Pulled onto and Icy Terrain immediately increase the Push or Pull effect by 1.
	When Icy Terrain is created in the following Terrain types, it interacts as follows:
* <ins>Blazing:</ins>  Instead, remove the Blazing Terrain and create Veiled Terrain.

name: Overgrown
effect:
Overgrown spaces costs twice as much Movement to move through, but a creature may take 2 Damage per space to move through them normally. 
	When Overgrown Terrain is created in the following Terrain types, it interacts as follows:
* <ins>Blazing:</ins> Overgrown Terrain may not be created in this space.
* <ins>Icicle, Icy:</ins> Remove the Icy or Icicle Terrain and replace it with Overgrown Terrain.

name: Blazing
effect:
Anytime a creature enters a Blazing space or ends a turn there they immediately take 1 True Damage and gains Burn 1. This may trigger at most once per Turn.
When Blazing Terrain is created in the following Terrain types, it interacts as follows:
* <ins>Icicle, Icy, or Wet:</ins> Instead, remove the Terrain and create a Veiled space.
* <ins>Overgrown:</ins> Remove the Overgrown Terrain and replace it with Blazing Terrain. 
* <ins>Windy:</ins> Blazing may not be created in this space.

name: Icicle
effect:
Icicle Terrain is covered in jagged lines of ice, creating a dangerous surface. A creature that moves into Icicle Terrain or ends a turn there immediately takes 3 Damage and gains Frost 1. They may negate both effects by paying 1 Reflex. This may trigger at most once per Turn. Regardless, after a creature would take damage from Icicle Terrain it is destroyed and becomes Icy Terrain. Icicle Terrain may be treated as Icy Terrain for all Actions that target it.
	When Icicle Terrain is created in the following Terrain types, it interacts as follows:
* <ins>Blazing:</ins> Instead, remove the Blazing Terrain and create Veiled Terrain.

name: Windy
effect:
Windy Terrain always has a direction, typically decided at the time of its creation. When entering a Windy space from the three faces aligned with its direction the Windy space only counts as half a space of movement. When entering a Windy space from the three faces against its direction it counts as two spaces of Movement. Ranged Attacks that pass through any Windy Terrain take a -1 penalty to their Attack Roll.
	When Windy Terrain is created in the following Terrain types, it interacts as follows:
 * <ins>Blazing or Veiled:</ins> Either remove the Terrain or move it one space in the direction of the Windy Terrain.
